H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H6743.def: = action by which an outside force (perhaps divine) quickly comes over a person, gaining control over the person or causing some immediate outcome

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H7951.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H974.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H2878.def: = act of killing an animal by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe + with a sharp-bladed instrument

H6942.def: = action by which humans that are part of a {L:holy<SDBH:קָדֹושׁ>} nation set themselves apart from others by not engaging in activities that are not in accordance with God's law

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2028.def: = the killing of domestic animals for food, sometimes extended to refer to the killing of people in a cruel and violent way

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H6212.def: = any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed-bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7273.def: = a person whose main activities take place on foot, as opposed to riding on an animal or in a vehicle

H3811.def: = action by which humans spend all their forces on a certain activity

H8474.def: = process by which humans gradually disappear from the face of the earth ◄ as if burnt away by fire

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1347.def: = dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals

H3383.def: = river; ◄ flowing from Mount {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>} in a southerly direction through the {L:Sea of Galilee<SDBH:כִּנֶּרֶת>} into the {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H6641.def: = state in which the skin of animal has spots, stains, and other irregular markings of skin

H5861.def: = class of larger birds of prey; ≈ associated with aggression and death

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H402.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H2513.def: = object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H6975.def: = small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
